content.description: Stand start on opposing sidepulls directly behind the Yellow Pine. Lock off to a rather abismal crimp and continue bumping up terrible holds to the lip. Climb up and left to top out on better holds.
content.location: As you hike up to the perch this problem is slightly right of the main trail directly behind a large yellow pine.

content.description: Sit start on decent sidepulls... reach up to a positive sloper rail. The finish gets spicy and balancey on small holds.
content.location: As you reach the Sunny perch head east ducking under a few boulders and you will find Wilbur... sloper rail is tough to miss.

content.description: Stand start on incut crimps, climb up the arete using jugs, slopers and crimps, to a slabby topout.
content.location: Sunny Perch

content.description: Start on the right side of the obvious crimp rail. Traverse left via crimps and slopers and topout on Stretch. PUMPY! Has also been climbed from right to left finishing on Footie Pajamas. Pick your poison.
content.location: Sunny Perch. Walk up and left from the Ice-9 boulder to find a large (usually sunny) wall with lots of boulder problems.

content.description: Stand start on the left side of the obvious rail, make a dynamic move up to the jug and topout on crimps.
content.location: Sunny Perch

content.description: Sit start on an awesome hueco.... Pick your poison: large dynamic move with a toe hook catch, or technical trickery on small crimps to gain a positive hold. From the "jug" work your way up on decent edges. The stand is also pretty fun and is significantly easier.
content.location: Furthest right problem on the perch. Gets more shade than the rest of the wall.

content.description: Establish on decent crimps - climb up and left on incut holds. Not the best rock quality.
content.location: As you hike up to the perch this problem is on the right directly behind a huge Ponderosa.

content.description: Clean OW that can be made more difficult by avoiding features on the faces. A good spot to practice basic OW technique.
content.location: This is the OW immediately left of Wilbur.

content.description: Another hard line out the pretty bulge on cool holds. Start to the left of The Megalomaniac on the leftmost part of the low rail. Grab the sweet mini pinch and make a few hard moves on more pinches to finish as for The Megalomaniac.
content.location: Left of The Megalomaniac.

content.description: Sit start on the rail, make a series of right hand moves on small crimps, then throw up and left to a good edge, hit the positive knob and top out. Sounds easy right?
content.location: Sunny Perch

content.description: Start on obvious slopers - squeeze your way up a compression feature utilizing a good undercling to a huge jug horn at the lip and a thoughtful top out.
Sit start on good holds - climb the short steep section, somewhat difficult pulling over onto the slab.
content.location: Small overhung boulder directly behind a large yellow pine.

content.description: Stand start on a huge jug undercling, climb up and left on pinches and edges to a committing slab topout.
content.location: Sunny Perch

content.description: Stand start on the rail, paste your foot on nothing smears and climb up through a cool gaston.
content.location: Sunny Perch

content.description: A fun easy problem on great rock. Start crouched on the big blob and make your way up the face on nice incuts.
content.protection: A pad or two, nice flat landing
content.location: If facing Virginia Beach/Hawaiian Punch, It’s the decent size boulder almost directly behind you with the big blob close to the ground.

content.description: Start on the rail just left of Footie Pajamas, pull on death crimps up the vertical face. Ouch.
content.location: Sunny Perch

content.description: Establish on two opposing crimps on the arete - make a desperate move to a flat rail - climb straight up on good edges.
content.location: Right arete behind a large ponderosa pine

content.description: Establish on a good rail - get traddy on an interesting press move with a biscuit like xenolith to good holds on the finish. Best rock on the wall on this one - not to be missed.
content.location: Tucked away on the perch in the corner where the wall transitions from south to west facing.

content.description: One of the more interesting problems on the perch, start on the rail just right of The Biscuit and mantle using the biscuit to stand tall to a positive crimp in the face. Positive holds on the lip to top out. This one is slightly contrived but it differs in that you climb straight out the face direct, not using the left arete.
content.location: As you hike up to the perch these problems are slightly right just behind a large yellow pine.

content.description: Sit start on a good hold on a detatched block. Utilize poor holds and good feet to establish on sloping edges. Trend up and left on sloping holds... Somewhat dangerous as you are spotted by a dead Juniper near the top.
content.location: From the Sunny Perch squeeze through the boulder pile heading east - This boulder problem is directly in front of a dead juniper.

content.description: Stand start on decent sloping edges, make a few difficult moves to gain a jug. Climb straight up over the buldge to a toilet bowl hueco on the top - watch out for pink eye.
content.location: East side of the jumbled boulders on the perch - just to the left of WIlbur

content.description: This is a great place to get some volume in without having to hike very far - there are approximately 20-25 problems on the perch. It is also a great place to basque in the sun on colder days. Although the rock is a bit fried, there are some good problems here and you are sure to build some skin. Classics in the area include Stretcher Traverse and Virginia Beach.
